title: 'Voluntary return' becomes a new path for many migrants in Tunisia
summary: Faced with the closure of the maritime route to the Italian island of Lampedusa, the International Organization for Migration (IOM) offers to fund the return of volunteers to their respective countries.

title: Putin claims Russia will pause 'all military actions' in Ukraine as part of 'Easter truce'
summary: The Russian president announced a truce from 6 pm Moscow time on Saturday to midnight Sunday. In response, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said if Russia is genuinely ready to observe a full and unconditional ceasefire, Ukraine will mirror that approach and strike only in defense.

title: US Supreme Court intervenes to block Trump deportations
summary: The decision was triggered by imminent plans late Friday to expel dozens more Venezuelans who would have been deported without the ability to hear evidence against them or challenge their cases. Trump's top immigration advisor, Stephen Miller, referred to the case Saturday as a 'media hoax.'

title: Thousands of trans rights supporters gather in London  following UK ruling over definition of woman
summary: The UK's Supreme Court has ruled that transgender women are excluded from the legal definition of a woman, someone born biologically female. The head of the Equality and Human Rights Commission said the ruling will mean transgender women will be excluded from women's toilets, hospital wards and sports teams.

title: Ligue 1: PSG maintain unbeaten record, Marseille back in second
summary: Paris Saint-Germain, beating Le Havre 2-1, had already secured a fourth successive Ligue 1 title before Saturday's game and their 10th consecutive league win leaves them on 77 points with five matches remaining.

title: The invisible poison threatening Arctic communities
summary: In her project "Under the Ice of the Arctic, Mercury," French photographer Juliette Pavy reveals an alarming reality unfolding far from the public eye: The increasing exposure of Indigenous populations in Greenland and Nunavut to concerning levels of methylmercury.

title: Tunisian court sentences opposition figures to up to 66 years in prison
summary: Well-known opposition figures, lawyers and business people were sentenced on Saturday for openly criticizing Tunisian President Kais Saied.

title: Iran, US to hold more nuclear talks after end of second round in Rome
summary: The Oman-mediated talks between the US and Iran, the second of its kind, lasted around four hours on Saturday.

title: JD Vance heads to Vatican after Pope Francis rebuke over US deportation policies
summary: The US vice president will meet a top Vatican official on Saturday amid tensions with Pope Francis over immigration, the war in the Gaza Strip and the freezing of international humanitarian aid.

title: In Israel, protests and 'fatigue' among reservists over the war in Gaza
summary: Reservists and retirees from the army and security services have denounced the impasse of the Netanyahu government's strategy in open letters published in the press.

title: Lyon beats Arsenal 2-1 in first leg of Women's Champions League semifinals
summary: Melchie Dumornay impressed for Lyon throughout, striking the crossbar with a 40-meter shot in the 33rd minute before eventually finding the target to halt Arsenal's second-half momentum and bolster her reputation as one of the world's best young players.

title: Students, journalists on trial in Turkey over Istanbul protests
summary: Ninety-nine defendants in one case appeared in court on Friday in Istanbul's Çaglayan neighborhood to face charges of participating in unauthorized demonstrations organized to protest the arrest of the city's mayor, Ekrem Imamoglu.

title: White House site blames China for Covid-19 'lab leak'
summary: The Covid.gov site also targets Anthony Fauci, Biden's former chief medical advisor, for advancing the 'narrative' that the virus 'originated naturally.' The lab-leak theory, once dismissed as a conspiracy theory, has regained traction in the US.

title: What could happen to Le Pen's conviction before the 2027 presidential election?
summary: The far-right leader was sentenced, at the end of March, to a five-year ban on running for office. She has appealed. Two years ahead of the presidential election, many questions remain regarding the upcoming stages of Marine Le Pen's legal procedure.

title: 2027 French election: The growing prospect of a CEO for president
summary: The French political landscape currently seems ripe for a major business leader to step onto the national stage. Emmanuel Macron's unexpected rise to power in 2017 has inspired the most ambitious figures.

title: At least 143 dead in DR Congo boat fire
summary: The total number of passengers on board the doomed vessel was not known, but an official from the region said it was in the hundreds.

summary: The Musée des Impressionnismes is showcasing 57 works acquired by David, Joseph and Ezra Nahmad, ranging from Jean-Baptiste-Camille Corot and Eugène Delacroix to Claude Monet and Odilon Redon.

title: A busy caterpillar, guardian of its domain
summary: Smaller than a grain of rice, the 'Falcaria bilineata' caterpillar uses undetectable vibratory strategies to defend its tiny territory, recently amplified and revealed by the work of Canadian biologists.

title: Is it ever a good idea to... wear a backpack?
summary: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the boundaries that should not be crossed. Or at least, to be aware when crossing them.

title: 'The relics of Jesus allow Catholicism to assert its foothold in areas where it is a minority'
summary: The tunic of Argenteuil, said to have been worn by Christ, is on display to the public at the Saint-Denys Basilica until May 11. In an interview, historian Nicolas Guyard traces the origins of this relic and analyzes the role of such objects in a secularized society and post-Vatican II Catholicism.

summary: The Israeli prime minister refused to end military operations in the enclave despite the risks to the 59 Israelis still held by Hamas and civilians in the area.

summary: French President Emmanuel Macron plans to head to the island on Tuesday as part of a five-day tour of Indian Ocean territories.

title: How Grindr shapes young gay men's sexualities: From idealized bodies to violence
summary: An entire generation of young queer men have explored their sexuality on Grindr, the gay dating app that recently turned 15. Today, many of them are questioning the influence the platform and its macho norms had on their emotional development.

title: Zelensky says Putin creating 'impression of a ceasefire' in Ukraine as Russian attacks continue
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin promised a ceasefire in Ukraine over the Easter weekend, but Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky reported Russian shelling on the wartorn country through Saturday night.

title: Pope Francis wishes faithful 'happy Easter' in Vatican appearance despite ill health
summary: Appearing in front of tens of thousands of people in St. Peter's Square on Sunday, Pope Francis condemned 'worrisome' anti-Semitism and the 'deplorable' situation in Gaza in a speech read out for him due to his ill health.

title: Elio Germano on portraying a mafia boss: 'This man would be laughable if he hadn't committed so many atrocities'
summary: In 'Sicilian Letters,' the Italian actor portrays mafia boss Matteo Messina Denaro, who was Italy's most wanted criminal for nearly 30 years.

title: Pregnancy denial, a frequent but mysterious disorder for doctors
summary: One in 500 women learns late that she is pregnant. One in 2,500 realizes it when giving birth. This psychological pregnancy disorder, the mechanisms of which remain difficult to understand, can affect all women, even those who are already mothers
